page.title: 19UPPER LANGWITH.
page.content: Upper Langwith is a small village with nineteen mostly{stone-built {houses,}some of which date from the 17th Century. The village contains a small{church}dating from Norman times, a{pub}called the Devonshire Arms, named after the Lord of the Manor and one{farm.} The rest of the homes are owned by people engaged in a variety of occupations. It's great living in upper Langwith. I live at The Cottage which is a stone built collection of a house and ten outbuildings surrounded by an orchard and gardens. The orchard contains a variety of fruit trees and I enjoy the Autumn picking time when we spend several days collecting the harvest of apples, damsons, pears, plums and greengages.
